summary: This document is an email chain from April 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding travel approval requests for the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The travel is for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and Fort Lauderdale, Florida, related to the enticement of minors for sexual activity.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: He is the recipient and approver of travel requests for the Epstein investigation. He sends an approval email on April 3, 2019.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: She is mentioned as a co-requester of travel for the Epstein investigation in an email dated April 3, 2019.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: She is a co-requester of travel with Michele Duncan for the Epstein investigation for meetings and interviews in Florida.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: He is the sender of the travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation on March 14 and April 3, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the defendant in the case United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, which is an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.

connections.description: Alex requests and Edward Tyrrell approves travel for the Epstein investigation, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or approval chain relationship within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
They are mentioned together as co-requesters for travel related to the Epstein investigation, indicating they are colleagues working on the same case.
Alex includes Michele Duncan as a co-requester in his travel request email, indicating they are colleagues collaborating on the Epstein investigation.
Alex includes Alison as a co-requester in his travel request email, indicating they are colleagues collaborating on the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Approval for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Edward Tyrrell approves a travel request for Assistant U.S. Attorneys to travel to Florida for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Alex sends an initial travel request for the Epstein investigation for meetings and interviews in Florida.

keyFacts: The document confirms active investigation work by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York into Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618) as of March-April 2019.
The investigation is explicitly described as 'relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Prosecutors were traveling to Florida (West Palm Beach and Fort Lauderdale) for meetings and interviews, indicating the geographic scope of the investigation.
The email chain shows internal DOJ procedures for travel approval in a high-profile case.
The document is dated after Epstein's 2019 arrest, indicating ongoing investigative activity post-arrest.
